japanese:
あっ、上杉さーん！
ちょうどいいところに！
translation:
Ah, Uesugi-san!
Good timing!

japanese: なんだ四葉、俺に用か？
translation: What's up Yotsuba, you need something from me?

japanese:
これから泳ぎに行きませんか？
せっかく沖縄に来たんです、海を堪能しましょう！
translation:
How about going swimming now?
We've come all the way to Okinawa,
let's enjoy the ocean!

japanese:
……お前、さっきまで
らいはたちと一緒に泳いでたよな？
translation:
...Didn't you just swim with Raiha
a little while ago?

japanese:
あれだけじゃ泳ぎ足りないですよ！
海がおいでおいでと手招きしてます！
translation:
I was just warming up!
The sea is beckoning me to come back!

japanese: その言い方は怖いぞ。
translation: That's a scary way to put it.

japanese:
（せっかくの誘いだが、
　俺が四葉の体力についていけるとは思えん）
translation:
(It's nice of her to invite me,
 but I don't think I can keep up
 with Yotsuba's stamina.)

japanese:
（運動にかけては、こいつの能力は
　他の追随を許さない域にあるからな……）
translation:
(When it comes to endurance,
 Yotsuba is in a league of her own...)

japanese: 悪いが俺は止めておく。
translation: Thanks for the invite, but I'll pass.

japanese:
ええー、上杉さんもですか。
三玖も嫌だって言うし。
translation:
Aww, Uesugi-san too?
Miku also said she doesn't want to join me.

japanese:
泳ぐのが嫌なんじゃなくて、
四葉の体力についていけないから無理。
translation:
It's not that we hate swimming,
it's just that we can't keep up with your stamina, Yotsuba.

japanese: だな、三玖の言うとおりだ。
translation: Yeah, Miku's right.

japanese:
でーもー。
みんな、もっと海を堪能したほうがいいですよぉ。
せっかくなのに。
translation:
Come on guys!
Try to enjoy the ocean as long as we're in Okinawa.
It's such a waste not to.

japanese:
四葉はレベルが違うから。
さっきまで一緒に泳いでた五月、ぐったりしてたよ。
translation:
You're on a different level, Yotsuba.
Itsuki was swimming with you earlier
and she was exhausted.

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese: もうやらかしてたか……。
translation: Did you overdo it again...?

japanese:
で、でも、らいはちゃんもいたから
ちゃんとペースは落としましたよ？
translation:
B-but, I did slow down my pace
since Raiha-chan accompanied us.

japanese:
だから、五月もらいはちゃんも
平気だったんじゃないかなぁと……。
translation:
I thought that Itsuki and Raiha-chan
were doing just fine...

japanese:
あのな、お前は体力馬鹿なんだから自重しろ。
お前の普通は、他の奴らにとっては普通じゃないんだ。
translation:
Listen, you're like a dolphin and your stamina level is off the 
charts. What's slow for you might be way too fast for others.

japanese:
うう、すみません。
海が綺麗だから、テンションが
上がっちゃってたかもしれません。
translation:
Ooohh, I'm sorry, I got carried away.
But the ocean was just too beautiful.

japanese:
まあ、こんなところで泳げる機会なんて
そうそうないし、はしゃいじまう気持ちは
わかるけどな。
translation:
I understand why you got so excited swimming through the 
Okinawan ocean. We don't come here very often.

japanese:
確かに。
沖縄に着いた時の
フータローのテンション、すごかった。
translation:
Indeed. I remember how excited you were
when we first arrived in Okinawa, Futaro.

japanese: うっ……。
translation: Oooh...

japanese:
やっぱり、私は
泳ぐよりも綺麗な海を眺めていたいかな。
translation:
But, personally,
I prefer admiring the beauty of the ocean
instead of swimming in it.

japanese:
見てるだけなんてもったいないよ。
せっかく沖縄に来たんだから泳ごう！
translation:
Just looking is a waste.
We came all the way to Okinawa, so let's swim!

japanese: でも、私はそれで充分楽しめるから。
translation: Enjoy yourself. I'll be admiring the ocean.

japanese:
しかし、眺めるだけはどうなんだ？
せっかく沖縄まで来たんだから
少しくらい泳いでおかないと損だろ。
translation:
But, is admiring the view really good enough?
We've come all the way to Okinawa,
we should at least swim a little.

japanese:
人それぞれの楽しみ方がある。
フータローに私の楽しみ方を否定されたくない。
translation:
Everyone has their own way of enjoying themselves.
I don't want you to deny my way of having fun.

japanese:
あ、えっと、海を眺めるのもいいよね！
ここで見える景色、絵みたいに綺麗だし！
translation:
Ah, uh, it's also nice to just admire the ocean!
The view from here is as beautiful as a painting!

japanese: 海の楽しみ方にだって色々あるもんね。
translation: So there are various ways to enjoy the ocean, huh.

japanese: うん、そういうこと。
translation: You bet!

japanese:
まあ、今日は夕方までここにいる予定だし
海を楽しもうぜ。
translation:
Well, we're here until the sun goes down. Which means
we have plenty of time to enjoy the ocean.

japanese: それじゃ、私はさっそく泳ぎに行ってきます！
translation: In that case, I'll go swimming now!

japanese:
少しセーブして泳げよ？
気がついたら沖の遊泳禁止区域まで
行ってそうだからな、お前は。
translation:
Just don't overdo it.
You're the type to end up
in the no-swim zone before you know it.

japanese:
どうせなら、どっちも楽しもうぜ。
思いっきり泳ぐのものんびり海を眺めるのも
一緒にやればいい。
translation:
How about doing both activities together?
We can swim to our heart's content, and afterwards relax
on the floater and gaze out at the sea.

japanese: ですよね！
translation: Good idea!

japanese:
でも、四葉とはちょっと。
ついていける自信がないし。
translation: But, I'm not sure I can keep up with you, Yotsuba.

japanese:
そんなハードに泳いだりしないよ！
ちゃんとペース調節するし。
translation:
Don't worry, I won't swim too fast!
I'll pace myself.

japanese: でも五月が。
translation: But, Itsuki got annihilated.

japanese: こ、今度はちゃんとするから！
translation: I-I'll behave myself better this time!

japanese:
まあ、今日は夕方までここにいる予定だし
海を楽しもうぜ。
translation:
Well, we're here until the sun goes down. Which means
we have plenty of time to enjoy the ocean.

japanese: それじゃ、私はさっそく泳ぎに行ってきます！
translation: In that case, I'll go swimming now!

japanese:
少しセーブして泳げよ？
気がついたら沖の遊泳禁止区域まで
行ってそうだからな、お前は。
translation:
Just don't overdo it.
You're the type to end up
in the no-swim zone before you know it.

japanese:
海の楽しみ方も色々だな。
泳ぐのも眺めるのも、それぞれいいところがある。
translation:
There are several ways to enjoy the ocean.
Swimming and gazing out at the sea
both have their merits.

japanese:
さっきの浮き輪みたいに、
のんびりできる手段も用意してくれてるのは
ありがたい話だ。
translation:
I appreciate that they provided us with
the floater earlier. It was so relaxing.

japanese:
私は、あまりハードに動きたくないから
浮き輪でのんびりするくらいがちょうどいい。
translation:
I don't really feel like doing anything too strenuous.
Right now relaxing on the floater sounds good to me.

japanese:
あれ、確かに気持ちよさそうだったね。
泳ぎ疲れたら、浮き輪に乗ってみようかな。
translation:
Oh, it did look very relaxing.
If we get tired of swimming,
we should try to rest on the floater.

japanese:
ああ、なかなか楽しめたぞ。
自然を全身で感じると言えばいいのか……
経験して損はない。
translation:
Yeah, it was really enjoyable. I guess you could say
that you become one with nature...
It's an experience worth having.

japanese: 自然に親しむ方法も人それぞれですもんね。
translation:
People have their own ways of getting close to nature,
don't they.

japanese: たまに聞く多様性ってそういうことかな。
translation: That's diversity, right?

japanese: それ、意味わかって言ってるか？
translation: Do you know what you're talking about?

japanese: 色々あるってことじゃないの？
translation: You can have different perspectives on the same subject, right?

japanese:
正確には、幅広く似た性質のものがあるって
ことなんだが。
translation:
Well, actually, it means
that there are many things that are similar in nature,
but have a wide range.

japanese:
いや、いい。
ここで説明するのも野暮だろ。
translation:
Nah, it's okay.
It's not really necessary to explain it here, is it?

japanese:
まあ、今日は夕方までここにいる予定だし
海を楽しもうぜ。
translation:
Well, we're here until the sun goes down. Which means
we have plenty of time to enjoy the ocean.

japanese: それじゃ、私はさっそく泳ぎに行ってきます！
translation: In that case, I'll go swimming now!

japanese:
少しセーブして泳げよ？
気がついたら沖の遊泳禁止区域まで
行ってそうだからな、お前は。
translation:
Just don't overdo it.
You're the type to end up
in the no-swim zone before you know it.

japanese: あはは、さすがにそんなことしませんって。
translation: Ahaha, c'mon, I wouldn't do that.

japanese:
もし気が変わったら言ってください。
一緒に泳ぎましょうね！
translation:
If you change your mind, let me know.
Let's go swimming!

japanese: そういえば、フータローは二乃と一緒じゃないんだ。
translation:
Come to think of it,
you aren't here with Nino, huh?

japanese: あ、ああ、まあな。
translation: W-well, I guess.

japanese: フータローは、もうちょっと二乃のこと……。
translation: Futaro, you should focus a little more on Nino...

japanese: え？　なんだ？
translation: Huh? What do you mean?

japanese:
ううん、やっぱりなんでもない。
わざわざ言ってあげることじゃなかった。
translation: Uh, nothing. Nevermind.

japanese: は？
translation: Huh?

japanese: 私たちはライバルだからね、二乃。
translation: Cause we're rivals, me and Nino.
